## Example: Pelaton 

In 2023, a consumer group surveyed $200$ people who reported purchasing a Pelaton bike in 20XX. The found the following 
a) Check the assumptions and conditions.
b) In a commercial for their product, Pelaton claims that, on average, $92\%$ of the people who bought their bike are still actively using it to work out. Use an appropriate hypothesis test to comment on their claim.
